content.introduction:
Checks for member expressions that access static members through instances, and
replaces them with uses of the appropriate qualified-id.

Example:

The following code:

struct
 
C
 
{


  
static
 
void
 
foo
();


  
static
 
int
 
x
;


  
enum
 
{
 
E1
 
};


  
enum
 
E
 
{
 
E2
 
};


};



C
 
*
c1
 
=
 
new
 
C
();


c1
->
foo
();


c1
->
x
;


c1
->
E1
;


c1
->
E2
;

is changed to:

C
 
*
c1
 
=
 
new
 
C
();


C
::
foo
();


C
::
x
;


C
::
E1
;


C
::
E2
;

The 
âfix
 commandline option provides default support for safe fixes, whereas

âfix-notes
 enables fixes that may replace expressions with side effects,
potentially altering the programâs behavior.
